Subassignment

Source: vignettes/subassign.Rmd
subassign.Rmd
library(tibble)

This vignette is an attempt to provide a comprehensive overview over all subassignment operations, highlighting where the tibble implementation differs from the data frame implementation.

new_df <- function() {
  df <- data.frame(a = 1:4)
  df$b <- letters[5:8]
  df$cd <- list(9, 10:11, 12:14, "text")
  df
}
new_tbl <- function() {
  as_tibble(new_df())
}

Results of the same code for data frames and tibbles are presented side by side:

new_df()
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

In the following, if the results are identical (after converting to a data frame if necessary), only the tibble result is shown, as in the example below. This allows to spot differences easier.

new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

For subassignment, we need a fresh copy of the data for each test. The with_*() functions allow for a more concise notation (with_tbl() omitted here for brevity):

with_df <- function(code, verbose = FALSE) {
  code <- rlang::enexpr(code)
  
  full_code <- rlang::quo({
    df <- new_df()
    !!code
    df
  })
  if (verbose) rlang::expr_print(rlang::quo_get_expr(full_code))
  rlang::eval_tidy(full_code)
}

This function takes an assignment expression and executes it on a fresh copy of the data. The first example prints what’s really executed, further examples omit this output.

with_df(df$a <- rev(df$a), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   df <- new_df()
#>   df$a <- rev(df$a)
#>   df
#> }
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 4 e          9
#> 2 3 f     10, 11
#> 3 2 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 1 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- rev(tbl$a), verbose = TRUE)
#> {
#>   tbl <- new_tbl()
#>   tbl$a <- rev(tbl$a)
#>   tbl
#> }
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>

$<-

Scalars and full length

Assigning a scalar or a full-length vector to a column consistently overwrites existing data or appends a new column at the end. Partial matching doesn’t happen:

with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl$b <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2     1 <int [2]>
#> 3     3     1 <int [3]>
#> 4     4     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl$c <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     1
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_tbl(tbl$cd <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e         1
#> 2     2 f         1
#> 3     3 g         1
#> 4     4 h         1
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl$b <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <int> <list>   
#> 1     1     4 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2     3 <int [2]>
#> 3     3     2 <int [3]>
#> 4     4     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl$c <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_tbl(tbl$cd <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         4
#> 2     2 f         3
#> 3     3 g         2
#> 4     4 h         1

Recycling

Tibbles allow recycling only for vectors of length 1 or of the same length as the data.

with_df(df$a <- 1:2)
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 1 e          9
#> 2 2 f     10, 11
#> 3 1 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 2 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1:2)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent
#> lengths, only values of length one
#> are recycled: #> * Length 4:
#> Existing data #> * Length 2: Column
#> `a`
 
with_df(df$a <- 1:3)
#> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> a, value = 1:3): replacement has 3
#> rows, data has 4
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1:3)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent
#> lengths, only values of length one
#> are recycled: #> * Length 4:
#> Existing data #> * Length 3: Column
#> `a`
 
with_df(df$a <- 1:5)
#> Error in `$<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> a, value = 1:5): replacement has 5
#> rows, data has 4
 
with_tbl(tbl$a <- 1:5)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent
#> lengths, only values of length one
#> are recycled: #> * Length 4:
#> Existing data #> * Length 5: Column
#> `a`
 
with_df(df$c <- 1:2)
#>   a b         cd c
#> 1 1 e          9 1
#> 2 2 f     10, 11 2
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 1
#> 4 4 h       text 2
 
with_tbl(tbl$c <- 1:2)
#> Tibble columns must have consistent
#> lengths, only values of length one
#> are recycled: #> * Length 4:
#> Existing data #> * Length 2: Column
#> `c`

Subset assignment

Updating parts of a column extracted by $ is the responsibility of the column vector. Tibbles can’t control what happens after $ has returned.

with_tbl(tbl$a[1:2] <- 4:3)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl$b[1:2] <- 4:3)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 4     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 3     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df$c[1:2] <- 4:3)
#>   a b         cd          c
#> 1 1 e          9          4
#> 2 2 f     10, 11          3
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$c[1:2] <- 4:3)
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: 'c'.
#> Tibble columns must have consistent
#> lengths, only values of length one
#> are recycled: #> * Length 4:
#> Existing data #> * Length 2: Column
#> `c`
 
with_tbl(tbl$cd[1:2] <- 4:3)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <int [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_df(df$a[1:3] <- 4:3)
#> Warning in df$a[1:3] <- 4:3: number of
#> items to replace is not a multiple of
#> replacement length
#>   a b         cd
#> 1 4 e          9
#> 2 3 f     10, 11
#> 3 4 g 12, 13, 14
#> 4 4 h       text
 
with_tbl(tbl$a[1:3] <- 4:3)
#> Warning in tbl$a[1:3] <- 4:3: number of
#> items to replace is not a multiple of
#> replacement length
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     4 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl$a[1:4] <- 4:3)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     4 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     3 h     <chr [1]>

For columns of the stricter "vctrs_vctr" class, this class implements the check, which then works identically for data frames and tibbles:

with_df({ df$v = vctrs::new_vctr(1:4); df$v[1:2] <- vctrs::new_vctr(4:3)})
#>   a b         cd v
#> 1 1 e          9 4
#> 2 2 f     10, 11 3
#> 3 3 g 12, 13, 14 3
#> 4 4 h       text 4
with_df({ df$v = vctrs::new_vctr(1:4); df$v[1:2] <- vctrs::new_vctr(letters[4:3])})
#> No common type for `x` <vctrs_vctr> and `value` <vctrs_vctr>.

[[<-

with_tbl(tbl[["a"]] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[["a"]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a     b     cd       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 x     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 x     f     <int [2]>
#> 3 x     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 x     h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[["b"]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 x     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 x     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 x     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[2, "a"]] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[2, "a"]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a     b     cd       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 1     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 x     f     <int [2]>
#> 3 3     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 4     h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[2, "b"]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 x     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[2, "cd"]] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <chr [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:2, "cd"]] <- "x")
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1:2, "cd", value = "x"): only a
#> single element should be replaced
 
with_tbl(tbl[[2, "c"]] <- "x")
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2, "c", value = "x"): replacing
#> element in non-existent column: c
 
with_tbl(tbl[[1:2, "c"]] <- "x")
#> Error in `[[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 1:2, "c", value = "x"): replacing
#> element in non-existent column: c
 
with_tbl(tbl[[c(2, 1)]] <- 1)
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: more
#> elements supplied than there are to
#> replace
 
with_tbl(tbl[[c(2, 1)]] <- "x")
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: more
#> elements supplied than there are to
#> replace
 
with_tbl(tbl[[c(1, 2)]] <- "x")
#> Error in x[[i]] <- value: more
#> elements supplied than there are to
#> replace

[<-

Scalars

with_tbl(tbl[1, "a"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, "b"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 1     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, "c"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>    NA
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>    NA
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>    NA
 
with_tbl(tbl[1, "cd"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Full length columns

with_tbl(tbl[, "a"] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "b"] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <int> <list>   
#> 1     1     4 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2     3 <int [2]>
#> 3     3     2 <int [3]>
#> 4     4     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "c"] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "cd"] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     1 e         4
#> 2     2 f         3
#> 3     3 g         2
#> 4     4 h         1
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "a"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     1 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "b"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2     1 <int [2]>
#> 3     3     1 <int [3]>
#> 4     4     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "c"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <dbl>
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>     1
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>     1
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>     1
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[, "cd"] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 e         1
#> 2     2 f         1
#> 3     3 g         1
#> 4     4 h         1

Multiple full length columns

with_tbl(tbl[, c("a", "b")] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <int> <list>   
#> 1     4     4 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3     3 <int [2]>
#> 3     2     2 <int [3]>
#> 4     1     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, c("a", "b")] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     1     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1     1 <int [2]>
#> 3     1     1 <int [3]>
#> 4     1     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, c("a", "b")] <- list(4:1, letters[4:1]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     4 d     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3 c     <int [2]>
#> 3     2 b     <int [3]>
#> 4     1 a     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, c("a", "b")] <- list(4:1, 1))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b cd       
#>   <int> <dbl> <list>   
#> 1     4     1 <dbl [1]>
#> 2     3     1 <int [2]>
#> 3     2     1 <int [3]>
#> 4     1     1 <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[, c("a", "b", "c")] <- list(4:1, letters[4:1]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 4
#>       a b     cd            c
#>   <int> <chr> <list>    <int>
#> 1     4 d     <dbl [1]>     4
#> 2     3 c     <int [2]>     3
#> 3     2 b     <int [3]>     2
#> 4     1 a     <chr [1]>     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[, c("a", "b", "cd")] <- list(4:1, letters[4:1]))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <int>
#> 1     4 d         4
#> 2     3 c         3
#> 3     2 b         2
#> 4     1 a         1

Full length rows

with_tbl(tbl[2, ] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 1     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2, ] <- "x")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a     b     cd       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 1     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 x     x     <chr [1]>
#> 3 3     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 4     h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2, ] <- list(1, "x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2, ] <- list(1, "x", 2))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2, ] <- list(1, "x", 2, 3))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2, , value = list(1, "x", 2, 3)):
#> provided 4 variables to replace 3
#> variables
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Multiple full length rows

with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 1     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 1     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- 1:2)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 1     <int [1]>
#> 3     2 2     <int [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- c("x", "y"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a     b     cd       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 1     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 x     x     <chr [1]>
#> 3 y     y     <chr [1]>
#> 4 4     h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- list(1:2, c("x", "y")))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <int [1]>
#> 3     2 y     <int [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- list(1:2, "x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <int [1]>
#> 3     2 x     <int [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- list(1, "x", 2))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>
 
with_tbl(tbl[2:3, ] <- list(1, "x", 2, 3))
#> Warning in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`,
#> 2:3, , value = list(1, "x", 2, 3)):
#> provided 4 variables to replace 3
#> variables
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <dbl> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 3     1 x     <dbl [1]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Unspecified

with_tbl(tbl[] <- 1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b    cd
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1     1     1     1
#> 2     1     1     1
#> 3     1     1     1
#> 4     1     1     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- 4:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b    cd
#>   <int> <int> <int>
#> 1     4     4     4
#> 2     3     3     3
#> 3     2     2     2
#> 4     1     1     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- 3:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b    cd
#>   <int> <int> <int>
#> 1     3     2     1
#> 2     2     1     3
#> 3     1     3     2
#> 4     3     2     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- 5:1)
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> value = 5:1): replacement has 5
#> items, need 12
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- list(1, "x"))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 x         1
#> 2     1 x         1
#> 3     1 x         1
#> 4     1 x         1
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- list(4:1, "x", 2))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <int> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     4 x         2
#> 2     3 x         2
#> 3     2 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2
 
with_tbl(tbl[] <- list(1, "x", 2))
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 x         2
#> 2     1 x         2
#> 3     1 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2

#> value = list(1, "x", 2, 3)): provided 4
#> variables to replace 3 variables
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl>

#> 2     1 x         2
#> 3     1 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2

#>       a b     cd

#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

#>   <int> <int> <int>
#> 1     4     4     4
#> 2     3     3     3
#> 3     2     2     2
#> 4     1     1     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- 3:1)
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a     b    cd
#>   <int> <int> <int>
#> 1     3     2     1
#> 2     2     1     3
#> 3     1     3     2
#> 4     3     2     1
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- 5:1)
#> Error in `[<-.data.frame`(`*tmp*`, ,
#> , value = 5:1): replacement has 5
#> items, need 12
 
with_tbl(tbl[,] <- list(1, "x"))

#>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl>

#> 2     1 x         1

#>   <int> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     4 x         2
#> 2     3 x         2
#> 3     2 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2

#>       a b        cd
#>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl>
#> 1     1 x         2
#> 2     1 x         2
#> 3     1 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2

#> value = list(1, "x", 2, 3)): provided 4
#> variables to replace 3 variables
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b        cd
#>   <dbl> <chr> <dbl>

#> 2     1 x         2
#> 3     1 x         2
#> 4     1 x         2

#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>       a b     cd       
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 f     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 g     <int [3]>
#> 4     4 h     <chr [1]>

Subset assignment

Due to tibble’s default of drop = FALSE, updating a portion of a [ subset is still safe, because tibble is still in control. Only one example is given here. (FIXME: It’s not safe yet.)

with_tbl(tbl["a"][1, ] <- "b")
#> # A tibble: 4 x 3
#>   a     b     cd       
#>   <chr> <chr> <list>   
#> 1 b     e     <dbl [1]>
#> 2 2     f     <int [2]>
#> 3 3     g     <int [3]>
#> 4 4     h     <chr [1]>

  • [<-

tibble is a part of the tidyverse, an ecosystem of packages designed with common APIs and a shared philosophy. Learn more at tidyverse.org.

Developed by Kirill Müller, Hadley Wickham. Site built by pkgdown.
